title: Stylish Task + Client Management app for a Tax Consulting firm

requirements.text: Create an authenticated single-tenant experience using Internet Identity so a signed-in user can access their own data; require sign-in before viewing or editing any clients/tasks.

quotes: i need a stylish Task/Client Managemnet app for my Tax consulting firm

acceptanceCriteria: When not signed in, the app shows a clear call-to-action to sign in with Internet Identity and does not display client/task data.
After signing in, the user can access the app features and only sees data associated with their principal.
Signing out returns the user to the signed-out state and hides any previously loaded data.

requirements.text: Implement backend data models and persistence for Clients and Tasks, scoped per signed-in principal, supporting full CRUD operations.
acceptanceCriteria: A Client record includes at minimum: id, name, primary contact (name/email/phone fields), tax year(s) (freeform or list), status (e.g., Active/Inactive), notes, createdAt, updatedAt.
A Task record includes at minimum: id, clientId, title, description/notes, status (e.g., To do/In progress/Blocked/Done), priority (Low/Medium/High), dueDate (optional), createdAt, updatedAt.

Backend exposes query and update methods to: list/get/create/update/delete clients; list/get/create/update/delete tasks; list tasks by clientId; and filter tasks by status and due date range (basic filtering).
All methods enforce that records are stored and retrieved only for the callerâ€™s principal (no cross-user access).

requirements.text: Build a responsive frontend UI for managing Clients (list + detail) with creation/editing forms, search, and basic filters.
acceptanceCriteria: Clients page shows a table/list of clients with quick search by name and a filter by status (Active/Inactive).
User can create a new client and edit/delete an existing client via validated forms (required name; email format validation when provided).
Client detail view shows client info and an embedded list of tasks for that client.
UI is responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Build a responsive frontend UI for managing Tasks with list views, quick actions, and task editing, including task assignment to a client.
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks page shows a list/table of tasks with filters for status and priority and sorting by due date.
User can create/edit/delete tasks; task form allows selecting a client, setting status/priority, and optionally setting a due date.
Task rows support quick status change (e.g., dropdown or inline control) without navigating away.
Overdue tasks are visually indicated (e.g., badge or subtle highlight).

requirements.text: Add a dashboard overview that surfaces key operational metrics relevant to a tax consulting workflow.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard displays: number of Active clients; count of open tasks (non-Done); count of overdue tasks; and tasks due in the next 7 days.
Each metric section links to the relevant filtered view (e.g., overdue tasks opens Tasks with overdue filter applied).

requirements.text: Implement frontend-backend data flow using React Query for all client/task reads and mutations, including loading, empty, and error states.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages that fetch data show a loading state while requests are in flight and an error state with retry when requests fail.
Mutations (create/update/delete) trigger cache invalidation/refetch so UI stays consistent without manual refresh.
Empty states are present for no clients and no tasks, with a clear action to create the first record.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, stylish visual theme appropriate for a tax consulting firm and enforce it consistently across layout, typography, spacing, and components (avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors).
acceptanceCriteria: The app uses a consistent design system with a distinct theme (e.g., warm neutrals + charcoal + sage accents), clear typographic hierarchy, and polished spacing.
Navigation (top bar and/or side nav) looks cohesive and remains consistent across all main views (Dashboard, Clients, Tasks, Settings/Profile).
Interactive states (hover/focus/disabled) are visually consistent and accessible.

requirements.text: Add generated static brand imagery and integrate it into the UI (no backend image routing).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
A small brand mark is used in the app header/navigation.
A subtle dashboard hero/banner graphic is used on the dashboard without harming readability.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all business logic in the main actor file).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutable paths defined by the platform; compose those components instead.
No external databases or third-party auth providers; use Internet Identity only.
nonGoals: Email/SMS sending, notifications, or calendar integrations.
Document storage, file uploads, or OCR of tax documents.
Advanced role-based access control (admin/staff) beyond per-principal data scoping.

required: Minimal monogram logo using a stylized letterform (e.g., T) in charcoal and sage on a transparent background (tax-monogram-logo.dim_256x256.png)
Wide subtle abstract banner background with warm cream paper texture and thin geometric lines in charcoal/sage (dashboard-banner.dim_1600x400.png)
